naturally_trimmed.config.trimmed_mobs.to: Settings for applying trims on a mobs armor pieces
naturally_trimmed.config.trimmed_mobs.ge:
Select the System of how to select, what trims to give mobs.
- Random Trims: Randomly choose the trim, but also take the previous trim highly into account.
- Custom Trims: Choose the trim out of a list of custom trims. You can manage the trims yourself
Chance of the mob having no trims at all
naturally_trimmed.config.trimmed_mobs.ra:
Settings for the Random Trims System.
These settings will only make a difference, if the random trims system is enabled.
Chance of each armor piece of a mob having an armor trim
Chance of each armor piece having a similar armor trim as the previous armor piece
naturally_trimmed.config.trimmed_mobs.tr:
Settings for the Custom Trim Combinations System.
These settings will only make a difference, if the custom trim combinations system is enabled.

Manage the custom trim combinations here. You can add, edit and remove combinations.

In the first option, enter the material of the armor, the combination can be applied to.
As an example: "iron".

In the rest of the options, enter the Trims for each armor piece.
In the left option, enter a valid trim material.
For example: "amethyst_shard".
In the right option, enter a valid trim pattern.
For example: "silence"

To not have to specify the whole trim pattern, you can leave out the "_armor_trim_smithing_template" part of the pattern, as it is the same for every pattern.

For each of the options, you'll see a preview. 
Having a question mark next to the preview, means the mod can't check for the validity of the option in the current environment. This happens when not inside a world.
If the preview is a barrier, the option is not valid.
naturally_trimmed.config.trimmed_chest_l: Settings for applying trims on a chests loot
Should apply trims on armor pieces inside a chest
Chance of each armor piece inside a chest having a trim applied
